City Council
============

Regular Meetings
----------------

* 7:00 pm
* 2nd and 4th Thursdays of each month
* Stanwood-Camano School District Administration Building  
  26920 Pioneer Highway, Stanwood

Special Meetings
----------------

* 5:00 pm [*Please refer to the calendar for posted special meetings.*](https://wa-stanwood.civicplus.com/calendar.aspx)
* Stanwood-Camano School District Administration Building  
  26920 Pioneer Highway, Stanwood

![Stanwood City Council - cropped](https://stanwoodwa.org/ImageRepository/Document?documentId=7609) Back Row:   Steve Shepro, Chili Hicks, Sid Roberts, Tim Schmitt, Andreena Bergman  
     Front Row:   Dani Gaumond, Marcus Metz, Darren Robb

All regular and special meetings of the Stanwood City Council are open to the public, except as provided for in [Revised Code of Washington (RCW) 42.30](http://apps.leg.wa.gov/RCW/default.aspx?cite=42.30&full=true). Council meetings are run in accordance with Council’s [Rules of Procedure.](https://stanwoodwa.org/DocumentCenter/View/7627/Rules-of-Procedure-FINAL-Feb-22-2024)

Public Comments
---------------

**Written Comments:** Anyone wishing to provide a written comment must submit it by 12:00 p.m. the day of the meeting by clicking this link [**Public Comment**](https://stanwoodwa.org/FormCenter/City-Clerk-5/City-Council-Meeting-Remote-Public-Comme-61) or by email [**city.clerk@ci.stanwood.wa.us**](mailto:city.clerk@ci.stanwood.wa.us)

**Verbal Comments:**  Anyone wishing to provide a verbal comment may do so by attending the city council meeting in person.

**Remote Comments:**  City of Stanwood council meetings can receive remote (online or phone-in) public comments by reasonable accommodation only.  Any requests for reasonable accommodations for remote participation, must be sent in writing to the City Clerk at[**city.clerk@ci.stanwood.wa.us**](mailto:cityclerk@stanwood.wa.us) no later than 12:00 p.m. on the day of the meeting.

Public Hearing
--------------

**Written Testimony:** Anyone wishing to provide a written testimony for a public hearing must submit it by 12:00 p.m. the day of the meeting by calling (360) 454-5213 or by clicking this link [**Public Hearing**](https://stanwoodwa.org/FormCenter/City-Clerk-5/Council-Meeting-Public-Hearing-Public-Co-69)

**Verbal Testimony:**  Anyone wishing to provide a verbal testimony may do so by attending the public hearing in person.

**Remote Testimony:**  City of Stanwood public hearings can receive remote (online or phone-in) testimony by reasonable accommodation only.  Any requests for reasonable accommodations for remote participation, must be sent in writing to the City Clerk at[**city.clerk@ci.stanwood.wa.us**](mailto:cityclerk@stanwood.wa.us) no later than 12:00 p.m. on the day of the meeting.

Agendas & Minutes
-----------------

Agendas are available prior to the meetings. Minutes are available following approval.  
[View Most Recent Agendas and Minutes](https://stanwoodwa.portal.civicclerk.com/)
